headline: Asian shares are mostly lower after a wild day on Wall St ends with modest moves
summary: Shares slipped Friday in Asia after a day of dramatic swings on Wall Street that included Microsoft’s worst drop in nearly six years.  Oil prices fell more than $1 and the prices of gold and silver weakened.  Tokyo's Nikkei 225 shed 0.5% to 53,119.18 as stocks related to artificial intelligence declined.

headline: US futures, precious metals fall after Trump says he is nominating Kevin Warsh to be next Fed Chair
summary: Futures fell on Wall Street Friday as word leaked that President Donald Trump would nominate former Federal Reserve official Kevin Warsh to be the next chair of the U.S. central bank.  Futures for the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average were each 0.5% lower before the opening bell.  Nasdaq futures were down 0.6%.
